00049 static __inline__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00050     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00051     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00052             : "=r" (word)
00053             : "r"  (word));
00054     return word;
00055 }
00056 
00057 static inline unsigned long long rtai_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00058                                               unsigned long uld,
00059                                               unsigned long *r) {
00060     /*
00061      * Fixed by Marco Morandini <morandini@aero.polimi.it> to work
00062      * with the -fnostrict-aliasing and -O2 combination using GCC
00063      * 3.x.
00064      */
00065 
00066     unsigned long long qf, rf;
00067     unsigned long tq, rh;
00068     union { unsigned long long ull; unsigned long ul[2]; } p, q;
00069 
00070     p.ull = ull;
00071     q.ull = 0;
00072     rf = 0x100000000ULL - (qf = 0xFFFFFFFFUL / uld) * uld;
00073 
00074     while (p.ull >= uld) {
00075         q.ul[1] += (tq = p.ul[1] / uld);
00076         rh = p.ul[1] - tq * uld;
00077         q.ull  += rh * qf + (tq = p.ul[0] / uld);
00078         p.ull   = rh * rf + (p.ul[0] - tq * uld);
00079     }
00080 
00081     if (r)
00082         *r = p.ull;
00083 
00084     return q.ull;
00085 }
00086 
00087 static inline int rtai_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00088 
00089     /* Returns (int)i = (int)i*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00090     
00091     int dummy;
00092 
00093     __asm__ __volatile__ ( \
00094         "mull %%edx\t\n" \
00095         "div %%ecx\t\n" \
00096         : "=a" (i), "=d" (dummy)
00097         : "a" (i), "d" (mult), "c" (div));
00098 
00099     return i;
00100 }
00101 
00102 static inline long long rtai_llimd(long long ll, int mult, int div) {
00103 
00104     /* Returns (long long)ll = (int)ll*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00105 
00106     __asm__ __volatile ( \
00107         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00108         "mull %%esi\t\n" \
00109         "movl %%eax,%%ebx\n\t" \
00110         "movl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00111         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00112         "mull %%esi\n\t" \
00113         "addl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00114         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00115         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00116         "movl %%eax,%%ecx\t\n" \
00117         "movl %%ebx,%%eax\t\n" \
00118         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00119         "sal $1,%%edx\t\n" \
00120         "cmpl %%edx,%%edi\t\n" \
00121         "movl %%ecx,%%edx\n\t" \
00122         "jge 1f\t\n" \
00123         "addl $1,%%eax\t\n" \
00124         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00125         "1:\t\n" \
00126         : "=A" (ll) \
00127         : "A" (ll), "S" (mult), "D" (div) \
00128         : "%ebx", "%ecx");
00129 
00130     return ll;
00131 }

00133 /*
00134  *  u64div32c.c is a helper function provided, 2003-03-03, by:
00135  *  Copyright (C) 2003 Nils Hagge <hagge@rts.uni-hannover.de>
00136  */
00137 
00138 static inline unsigned long long rtai_u64div32c(unsigned long long a,
00139                                                 unsigned long b,
00140                                                 int *r) {
00141     __asm__ __volatile(
00142        "\n        movl    %%eax,%%ebx"
00143        "\n        movl    %%edx,%%eax"
00144        "\n        xorl    %%edx,%%edx"
00145        "\n        divl    %%ecx"
00146        "\n        xchgl   %%eax,%%ebx"
00147        "\n        divl    %%ecx"
00148        "\n        movl    %%edx,%%ecx"
00149        "\n        movl    %%ebx,%%edx"
00150        : "=a" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[0]), "=d" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[1])
00151        : "a" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[0]), "d" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[1]), "c" (b)
00152        : "%ebx"
00153        );
00154 
00155     return a;
00156 }

00225 static inline unsigned long long rtai_rdtsc (void) {
00226     unsigned long long t;
00227     __asm__ __volatile__( "rdtsc" : "=A" (t));
00228     return t;
00229 }

00279 /* rtai_get_current() is Adeos-specific. Since real-time interrupt
00280    handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI domain stack, we cannot
00281    infere the "current" Linux task address using %esp. We must use the
00282    suspended Linux domain's stack pointer instead. */
00283 
00284 static inline struct task_struct *rtai_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00285 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,0)
00286     return (struct task_struct *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~8191UL));
00287 #else /* LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,0) */
00288     return ((struct thread_info *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~8191UL)))->task;
00289 #endif /* LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,0) */
00290 }
00291 
00292 static inline struct task_struct *rtai_get_current (int cpuid)
00293 
00294 {
00295     int *esp;
00296 
00297     __asm__ volatile("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r" (esp));
00298 
00299     if (esp >= rtai_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rtai_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048)
00300         return rtai_get_root_current(cpuid);
00301 
00302     return get_current();
00303 }

00308 static inline void rt_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00309 
00310     rtai_cli();
00311     rt_spin_lock(lock);
00312 }
00313 
00314 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00315 
00316     rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00317     rtai_sti();
00318 }

00320 static inline unsigned long rt_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00321 
00322     unsigned long flags;
00323     rtai_local_irq_save(flags);
00324     rt_spin_lock(lock);
00325     return flags;
00326 }

00328 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00329                                              spinlock_t *lock) {
00330     rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00331     rtai_local_irq_restore(flags);

00334 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00335 
00336 #define CPU_RELAX(x) \
00337 do { \
00338    int i = 0; \
00339    do \
00340      cpu_relax(); \
00341    while (++i < x); \
00342 } while(0)
00343 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00344 #define CPU_RELAX(x)
00345 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00351 static inline void rt_get_global_lock(void) {
00352 
00353     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00354 
00355     rtai_cli();
00356 
00357 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00358     adeos_load_cpuid();
00359 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00360 
00361     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_lock))
00362         while (test_and_set_bit(31,&rtai_cpu_lock))
00363             CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00364 }
00365 
00366 static inline void rt_release_global_lock(void) {
00367 
00368     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00369 
00370     rtai_cli();
00371 
00372 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00373     adeos_load_cpuid();
00374 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00375 
00376     if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_lock)) {
00377         clear_bit(31,&rtai_cpu_lock);
00378         CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00379     }
00380 }
00381 
00394 static inline void rt_global_cli(void) {
00395     rt_get_global_lock();
00396 }
00397 
00404 static inline void rt_global_sti(void) {
00405     rt_release_global_lock();
00406     rtai_sti();
00407 }
00408 
00415 static inline int rt_global_save_flags_and_cli(void) {
00416 
00417     unsigned long flags = rtai_get_iflag_and_cli();
00418     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00419 
00420 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00421     adeos_load_cpuid();
00422 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00423 
00424     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_lock))
00425         {
00426         while (test_and_set_bit(31,&rtai_cpu_lock))
00427             CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00428 
00429         return flags | 1;
00430         }
00431 
00432     return flags;
00433 }
00434 
00442 static inline void rt_global_save_flags(unsigned long *flags) {
00443 
00444     unsigned long hflags = rtai_get_iflag_and_cli(), rflags;
00445     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00446 
00447 #ifdef adeos_load_cpuid
00448     adeos_load_cpuid();
00449 #endif /* adeos_load_cpuid */
00450 
00451     if (test_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_lock))
00452         rflags = hflags;
00453     else
00454         rflags = hflags | 1;
00455 
00456     if (hflags)
00457         rtai_sti();
00458 
00459     *flags = rflags;
00460 }
00461 
00469 static inline void rt_global_restore_flags(unsigned long flags) {
00470 
00471     switch (flags)
00472         {
00473         case (1 << RTAI_IFLAG) | 1:
00474 
00475             rt_release_global_lock();
00476             rtai_sti();
00477             break;
00478 
00479         case (1 << RTAI_IFLAG) | 0:
00480 
00481             rt_get_global_lock();
00482             rtai_sti();
00483             break;
00484 
00485         case (0 << RTAI_IFLAG) | 1:
00486 
00487             rt_release_global_lock();
00488             break;
00489 
00490         case (0 << RTAI_IFLAG) | 0:
00491 
00492             rt_get_global_lock();
00493             break;
00494         }
00495 }

00497 static inline void rt_switch_to_real_time(int cpuid) {
00498 
00499     TRACE_RTAI_SWITCHTO_RT(cpuid);
00500     rtai_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask = rtai_get_current(cpuid);
00501     rtai_linux_local_irq_save(rtai_linux_context[cpuid].oldflags);
00502     set_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_realtime);
00503 }
00504 
00505 static inline void rt_switch_to_linux(int cpuid) {
00506 
00507     TRACE_RTAI_SWITCHTO_LINUX(cpuid);
00508     clear_bit(cpuid,&rtai_cpu_realtime);
00509     rtai_linux_local_irq_restore_nosync(rtai_linux_context[cpuid].oldflags,cpuid);
00510     rtai_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask = NULL;
00511 }
00512 
00513 static inline struct task_struct *rt_whoislinux(int cpuid) {
00514 
00515     return rtai_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask;
00516 }

00518 static inline int rt_is_linux (void) {
00519 
00520     return !test_bit(adeos_processor_id(),&rtai_cpu_realtime);
00521 }
00522 
00523 static inline int rt_is_lxrt (void) {
00524 
00525     return test_bit(adeos_processor_id(),&rtai_cpu_lxrt);
00526 }

00528 static inline void rt_set_timer_delay (int delay) {
00529 
00530     if (delay) {
00531         unsigned long flags;
00532         rtai_hw_lock(flags);
00533 #ifdef __USE_APIC__
00534         apic_read(APIC_TMICT);
00535         apic_write(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00536 #else /* !__USE_APIC__ */
00537         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00538         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00539 #endif /* __USE_APIC__ */
00540         rtai_hw_unlock(flags);
00541     }
00542 }
